name: Muzio Clementi
notableWorks: Piano Sonata in B flat Major, Op. 24, No. 2
Symphony No. 3 in G Major, 'The Great National'
biography: Muzio Clementi was an Italian-born English composer, pianist, pedagogue, conductor, music publisher, editor, and piano manufacturer. He is acknowledged as the first to write specifically for the piano. He is best known for his piano sonatas, sonatinas, and his pedagogical work, 'Gradus ad Parnassum'. Clementi's influence on the development of Classical piano music is considerable.
